[File: stacks-core/stacks-node/src/nakamoto_node/miner.rs] [Function: validate_timestamp_info()] [Saturating Subtraction] current_timestamp_secs.saturating_sub(parent_timestamp) prevents underflow - but can negative time deltas (clock skew) cause blocks to be incorrectly accepted? (High)

[File: stacks-core/stacks-node/src/nakamoto_node/miner.rs] [Function: validate_timestamp_info()] [Millisecond Conversion] time_since_parent_ms multiplies by 1000 - can this multiplication overflow for very large timestamp differences, causing incorrect validation? (Low)
